result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony Lamont Prince was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court finds defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program but is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program after 4 years
Probation is concurrent with the sentence imposed as to Case# 21CF04867

miscConds.notes: Provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis and pay any mandatory costs, fees, assessments or surcharges (if not already done so) during the term of probation or extended supervision. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. If confinement is served - DOC to collect monetary sums/amounts at a rate (to be determined by DOC) of prison funds. Court waives non-mandatory costs, fees, assessments and surcharges due to defendant's inability to pay.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION/EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
- Seek/maintain employment.
Court ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms; further, defendant is advised he cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.
- NO CONTACT ORDER with the MacCanon Brown Homeless Sanctuary.

- AODA assessment and comply with any recommended treatment.
- Random urine screens.
Court sets restitution at $1,100 payable to MacCanon Brown Homeless Sanctuary.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anthony Lamont Prince

records.addlTxt:
Decision And Order Denying Motion For Sentence Credit

-  signed by the Court (electronically)

-  copy to be mailed to defendant
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Mark A. Sanders, Br. 28, for review. mag
Defendant's Notice of Motion and Motion for Sentence Credit.  (Anthony L. Prince - #2022000053, House of Correction, 8885 S 68th St, Franklin WI 53132).
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief - received

Sentencing proceeds.  State has complied with victim notification.  Statements by the State, defense counsel and defendant.  

-  Court sets Restitution at $1,100 - payable to MacCanon Brown Homeless Sanctuary

As to Count 1:
COURT ORDERS defendant to serve a term in the Wisconsin State Prison system - TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE -  6  years, with  97  days credit; INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT -  3  years; EXTENDED SUPERVISION -  3 years.  
COURT STAYS the sentence and places the defendant on probation for a period of 4  years.

Court finds defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program but is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program after four years.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-  Probation is concurrent with the sentence imposed as to Case# 21CF04867
-  AODA assessment and comply with any recommended treatment
-  Random urine screens
-  Seek/Maintain employment
-  No Contact Order with the MacCanon Brown Homeless Sanctuary
-  Court waives non-mandatory costs, fees, assessments and surcharges due to defendant's inability to pay.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-  AODA assessment and comply with any recommended treatment
-  Random urine screens
-  Seek/Maintain employment
-  No Contact Order with the MacCanon Brown Homeless Sanctuary
-  Court waives non-mandatory costs, fees, assessments and surcharges due to defendant's inability to pay.

COURT ORDERS:
-  defendant to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis and pay any mandatory costs, fees, assessments or surcharges (if not already done so) during the term of probation or extended supervision. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
if confinement is served - DOC to collect monetary sums/amounts at a rate (to be determined by DOC) of prison funds.

Appeal rights given.

Defendant Anthony Lamont Prince in court with Attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Anthony Lamont Prince in custody.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties appear in person.
Defendant has two cases before the court.
Defendant is prepared to enter a plea.

As to Count  1:
Defendant advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties; waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of   GUILTY   and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint and orders a judgment of conviction be entered.

As to Counts  2, 3 and 4:
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court orders Counts  2, 3, and 4   DISMISSED but read-in as to sentencing.

COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms; further, defendant is advised he cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  Defendant was further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. 

Parties are prepared to proceed to sentencing.
